comments.author: Attila Radnai

comments.text:
Overall, it wasn't a bad movie. Not too hard to follow even if you weren't 
familiar with the Star Trek universe which is nice but it also had 
references for those who can pick them out. The characters were nicely 
chosen and easy recognizable due to traits and similar features, it's easy 
to tell that they really worked hard to find actors who worked... And it 
did. I felt attached to many of the characters on screen, for better or 
worse. It may seem I'm praising this movie very highly and I apologize but 
while I understand it wasn't the best, I can hardly say it was the worse. 

The only unredeeming feature and complaint I have is the lense flares. Most 
of the time they were HIGHLY unnecessary. If they were just in combat and 
action scenes, hey, I could understand but they were everywhere. A 
character would be talking and then, everything would go white and it would 
be hard to see what was happening for a few seconds as your eyes tried to 
adjust. It was like the person in charge of that part of the effects team 
knew they were getting fired and just decided 'fuck it. I don't even care 
anymore.'

Overall: It's not a movie I would recommend for those who are easy 
triggered by sudden lights or have epilepsy. I had to pause the movie a bit 
to take a break, that's how crazy it got. But other then that, it was an 
enjoyable experience and it's now happily on my dvd shelf now.﻿

comments.author: DavidAtomic

comments.text:
I am not sure why everyone is so pissed about these new movies.  Are they 
better than the original Trek movies?  No.  But, they are good.  It brings 
Trek back, and they did it in such a way that actually doesn't throw away 
any cannon.  They can easily go back tot he prime timeline if they want 
to.  Things like Batman and Superman redo their origins all the time and no 
one complains.  As long as we have the prime timeline, I for one don't mind 
a new timeline.﻿

comments.text:
In this movie Spock Prime tells his younger self, " since my customary 
farewell would seem oddly self serving, ....." the way he said it, it seems 
that it is HIS customary farewell, not the Vulcan customary farewell. If he 
would have said, "since THE customary farewell..." it would have seemed 
like a "Vulcan" thing. I guess my point is, all Vulcans say that, but he 
said as if they all have different individual farewells. Am I making sense? 
Probably not, I'll just go fuck myself. ﻿
